executive_summary: The Body Piercing Studios industry is composed of individuals and companies that provide piercing services, which involve puncturing or inserting jewelry into the skin. Piercing and body modification has existed for thousands of years; however, in modern times, piercing has been a relatively stable fashion trend. While piercings, such as navel piercing and nipple piercing, move in and out of style, piercing in general has remained popular for the past several decades. Commonly accepted styles in particular, such as ear piercings, have had strong staying power, keeping the industry relevant throughout its history.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industry revenue has decreased at an annualized rate of 4.6% to $516.2 million over the five years to 2021, largely due to a 35.4% drop in 2020 alone. In 2021, however, industry revenue is expected to grow 5.9%.

The industry is predominately composed of small nonemployers with low overhead costs, low start-up costs and few barriers to entry, allowing small companies to easily enter the industry. Although companies can easily enter the industry, it can be difficult for them to succeed and stay in the industry over the long term, especially as it has become slightly saturated. Combined with the adverse effects of the coronavirus pandemic, the number of enterprises has declined at an annualized rate of 4.1% to 9,130 companies over the five years to 2021. Additionally, the average industry profit margin, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, has declined over the past five years, comprising an estimated 7.6% of revenue in 2021.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, as the pandemic subsides, continued growth in per capita disposable income levels will likely support a recovery in industry revenue. While piercing styles are subject to change over the next five years, the industry is likely to stay popular as a whole, maintaining demand for industry services. As a result, industry revenue is projected to rise at an annualized rate of 4.3% to $637.1 million over the five years to 2026.

Higher industry profit is expected during the outlook period. The average industry profit margin, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, is projected to recover to pre-pandemic levels, accounting for 8.3% of revenue in 2026.
Over the five years to 2026, total wage costs are projected to increase at an annualized rate of 2.8% to $210.5 million.

industry_definition: The Body Piercing Studios industry provides body piercing services, which involve puncturing the skin to display ornamental jewelry. This industry does not include jewelry sellers that provide ear piercing services as a complementary service.

negative_impact_factors: Low and steady barriers to entry level

opportunities: Demand from jewelry and watch wholesaling

key_trends: Despite low barriers to entry, operator numbers have been falling
The industry has contended with competition from less-skilled and unlicensed piercers
Disposable incomes and fashion trends weigh heavily on industry demand
Increasing popularity and acceptance of piercings will support industry growth
Industry revenue is forecast to rebound after plummeting in 2020 amid the pandemic

market_segmentation.segment_description: Piercings are most common among young people since they are often seen as rebellious. However, this segment is slightly limited, as many states have strict regulations about piercing minors.
Adults between the ages of 25 and 34 account for a significant amount of industry revenue as they are still interested in piercings and may have jobs where piercings are acceptable.
Demand for industry services declines as people age, as older individuals are less likely to keep up with fashion and style trends.
Older people are more likely to have jobs where piercings are not permitted, so demand is lower in this age group.

products_and_services.product_description: Ear piercings are the most popular style of piercings offered in the industry, accounting for an estimated 57.4% of revenue in 2021.
Facial piercings like nose and eyebrow piercings represent the second-largest category, accounting for an estimated 25.7% of revenue in 2021.
Nipple piercings have rapidly grown in popularity over the past five years, accounting for an estimated 8.9% of revenue in 2021.
Other piercings like tongue, lip, navel and genital piercings account for the remaining 7.1% of industry revenue.

tier_1_suppliers: Jewelry & Watch Wholesaling in the US
Drug, Cosmetic & Toiletry Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Generic Pharmaceutical Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for the Body Piercing Studios industry is primarily based on the average level of disposable income, because piercings are considered a luxury.
Demand for particular styles of piercings can vary based on trends in consumer preferences.
Piercings are generally seen as a trend for young people, so industry demand increases when the number of adults between the ages of 20 and 64 increases.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Due to the service-based nature of the industry, the Body Piercing Studios industry does not participate in international trade.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region accounts for 25.8% of the population and comprises 24.1% of industry establishments.
California, which is the most populous state, is anticipated to comprise 11.3% of industry establishments.
New York is expected to account for 10.8% of industry establishments due to the presence of prominent art scenes in neighborhoods like SoHo and Greenwich Village.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Body Piercing Studios industry does not contend with a significant amount of regulation from state and local government bodies.
To prevent the spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus), most state governments required nonessential businesses, which include industry operators, to temporarily close in mid-March 2020.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The initial capital cost of starting a piercing studio are relatively low. Piercing needles do not have a high price, while other equipment including chairs and privacy screens can typically be found for low prices.
While industry associations suggest more thorough training, many states require only basic training for applicants to become licensed piercers.

Industry associations have pushed for higher industry standards that make entering the industry more difficult, such as completing an apprenticeship and taking courses in first aid, bloodborne pathogens, anatomy, safety and hygiene.

basis_points.basis_description: The Body Piercing Studios industry has a high level of internal competition, because it is easy for a new studio to enter the industry. Piercing studios compete on the basis of price, convenience, quality and variety of services offered.

Some companies outside of the industry offer piercing services as a complementary service when customers purchase jewelry. These retailers often use piercing guns and do not require employees to be licensed piercers, because the service is offered for free.

concentration_points.concentration_description: There are no major players in this industry.
The vast majority of operators in the Body Piercing Studios industry are single-location studios. In 2021, more than 90.0% of industry operators are expected to be nonemployers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage expenses represent the largest operating cost for the average body piercing studio. Body piercing services must be offered by skilled employees, as piercing can carry a high risk of infection if not performed properly.

Purchase costs for operators in this industry include cleaning supplies, needles and jewelry. Purchase costs can fluctuate when jewelry prices increase, as jewelry is the most significant cost for industry companies.
Body piercing studios have moderate capital expenses, including the cost of piercing equipment, chairs and privacy curtains.
Reputation is a crucial factor in driving demand for body piercing studios. Body piercing studios often manage their reputations through marketing.
Rent includes the cost of the physical locations in which studios operate. Body piercing studios often establish themselves in hip neighborhoods where rent costs are high.
Utility costs include the cost of heat and electricity, and most of the equipment used in piercing studios is electric.
Other costs for piercing studios include legal fees, employee training and other miscellaneous expenses.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Wages are the primary expense for body piercing studios since piercing services require skilled piercing artists to operate the equipment.
While the industry does have specific equipment, the cost of these tools pales in comparison to the cost of labor.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Demand based on trends and income
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand for body piercing is largely based on consumer trends and disposable income.
In 2020, industry revenue declined significantly as industry establishments were required to close to slow the spread of coronavirus, thus directly reducing industry revenue.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Body Piercing Studios industry has been resistant to technological disruption. The services offered by the industry often change as new styles of piercings become popular. However, these new styles rarely change how industry operators conduct business.

The Body Piercing Studios industry requires highly specialized equipment, given the high risk associated with the practice. If proper safety procedures aren't followed, clients could develop infections.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales reliant on the overall health of the US economy (i.e. consumer spending and per capita disposable income)?
FAQs.answer: Demand for piercings is mainly based on people's ability to pay for them.

FAQs.question: Does your company partner with local businesses for mutually-beneficial advertising?
FAQs.answer: Many piercing artists partner with tattoo artists to save space and share resources.

FAQs.question: Is your company conveniently located in high-traffic areas to maximize visibility?
FAQs.answer: While piercing often aren't impulse purchases, seeing a piercing studio can spark a customers interest.

FAQs.question: How does your company provide ancillary services to diversify revenue streams?
FAQs.answer: Most piercing artists are able to perform a wide variety of different piercing styles.

FAQs.question: Does your company leverage social media platforms, such as Facebook, Twitter and Yelp, to establish a stronger market presence?
FAQs.answer: Most piercing studios will share photos on Instagram and Facebook to promote their services.

FAQs.question: Is your company leveraging new technology, such as mobile phone applications, to streamline booking and communication with clients?
FAQs.answer: Customers may be nervous when going in for an appointment, so appointment management is crucial to reduce client stress.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Many piercing studios go beyond state regulations to ensure safe procedures are being performed.

FAQs.question: Have you had any regulatory expenses that have significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Maintaining a sterile work environment can create additional costs that hurt profit margins in the short-term.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins can vary based on the types and quality of services studios provide.

FAQs.question: How frequently does your company have to replace its equipment?
FAQs.answer: Certain piercing tools need to be replaced between each appointment.

FAQs.question: How do you develop and maintain a good reputation? How much customers do you receive from recommendations?
FAQs.answer: Given the risks of a poorly done piercing, individuals look for body piercing studios that maintain strong reputations.

FAQs.question: What do you look for when hiring new employees? How do you go about training your employees?
FAQs.answer: Body piercing studios need piercing artists that are highly skilled in their craft to attract and maintain customers.

FAQs.question: Which key markets are you located in close proximity? How do you adjust if you're located outside of key markets?
FAQs.answer: Body piercing studios typically operate in cities where they are more likely to find young, hip consumers.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your sales are to adults 20 to 64? What other markets are significant to your business?
FAQs.answer: Piercings are considered a style mainly for young people. This is partially due to the fact that many traditional offices do not consider piercings to be acceptable.

FAQs.question: How has access to credit affected your company thus far? How can you take advantage as access to credit increases?
FAQs.answer: While opening a piercing studio does not involve significant capital investment, some start-up costs are involved. When access to credit rises, aspiring piercing artists are more likely to be able to acquire small business loans to open their own studios.

FAQs.question: How do fluctuations in per capita disposable income affect your company? How do you go about pricing your products and services?
FAQs.answer: Demand for piercing services is largely based on people's ability to pay for them, because piercing is considered a luxury service. When disposable income rises, does demand for piercing studios expands as well.
